Reviews.Title: “MOLD beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Reneey92
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the staff was wonderful. They were very kind and helpful-no complaint in that area. The location was good-walking distance to Fagers Island and Dead Freddys and of course the beach. However that is where it ends..... Mold mold mold!! Room 302 beware!! The cleaning ladies used bleach to try to control the mold and it made it smell horrible!! Mold on the ceiling-baseboard-tub-EVERYWHERE!! Not as clean as it should be either. The pool area is in need cleaning too. The soda machine at the pool area scocked ( electric shock) a 18 month little boy- the staff knew about the problem (from previous complaints) and did nothing about it. I will NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Area for improvement......”
Reviews.Author: JRuane4985
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful with its high ceilings, water feature and "stairs to no where".... but then you get on the unpolished elevator.... my husband actually tried to wash off the stans... it needs a good polish and can look much better. Next is the outside pool area..... need to a pressure washing and some new flower pots...... and chair cleaning.... but then it would be so much nicer. Also they should either close in the pool bar area or get rid of all the junk thrown back there.....As for the remainder of my review.... studio was a nice size with small kitchen area. Balcony are for "show" only.... no where to actually sit.... we would stay there again since the staff were very friendly,rooms were clean, great location on the bay... near Mackeys (best meal of the week), Fagler Island and Dead Freddies (best bar in town)....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JDi509
Reviews.Content: The Coconut Malorie is a great place to stay for anyone. We stayed as a family and were very comfortable. Nice views of the bay and Fager's Island. Rooms are very nicely decorated and have kitchens with dishes and everything you need. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pmonachina
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Ocean City, but want to avoid the hassle of the Boardwalk, stay here. Located on 59th Street, the beach is a short walk away. A great restaurant nearest close by and the bay is beautiful. The resort needs some fixing up, but overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: debbm67
Reviews.Content: I struggle to find anything good to say. After I stepped in the vomit that was left from the last guest I think it's hard to find anything good to say. From dirty poop stained plungers under the sink to boogies left smeared on the bathroom mirror. Really, not one even remotely good thing. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “As an owner, I was surprised”
Reviews.Author: PhilZ1953
Reviews.Content: Just to be honest. I am an owner at the Coconut Malorie Resort and have been since 2002. So I have seen this resort change ownership at least 4 times. Some for the good and others not so good. So to say I was surprised when I checked in was an understatement. Since 2007 whenever I checked I checked in, I had to do battle with the front desk staff. My wife has bad legs and 9 times out of 10 one or both of the elevators are down for repairs. I was told that since I check in on a Saturday I HAD to except an upper floor room. So this year again I was expecting another battle. Since Festiva Hospitality Group took over it was such a joy to check in. All new front desk staff were more then willing to accomondate us on a lower floor. It fact they were very happy because most people want a room on the upper floors and that freed up one more room for them. Check in went smoothly. As an owner, I can say that not much has changed. The rooms are quite roomy and bright. Still has a tiny kitchen area. No big deal but still quite crowded. Stil have the mismatched eating utensils and pots and pains have seen better days. But a BIG PLUS. Festiva has stopped the Fager's Island valets from using the resort parking lot to park cars. So now if you go out you do not have to park out on the street (if you can find a spot) when you come home after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: capsgirl1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and the staff of Festiva Owner Group was very helpful and pleasant. Clean and nicely furnished. Good location with easy walk to the beach. Only negative was drunk people crashing into outside wall of our room at 2:30 in the morning. Perhaps concentrating on family only rentals would help with this problem However, I would still stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Management was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: While staying at this resort with my parents $85.00 was stole from my purse in the room. The only people who had keys to the room were my parents and myself. I filled out an incident report and spoke to the manager the next morning, the manager did not apologize for what had happened. Instead he told me that on the back of my door was a plaque relieving the hotel of any liability if anything was stolen. He also said that I should put valuable items in their safe whenever I leave the room. I responded with "I can not expect items in a locked room to be safe in this hotel?" Upon returning to my room there was no information on the back of the door. I made sure to call the manager to tell him if that is his excuse then he should check the back of the doors to make sure there is a plaque with that information. I understand the hotel can not be liable for everything that could happen, but at least you could apologize and get the fact that a person in your staff is going through your guests belongings and taking what they please. The manager had no empathy at all or the situation and didn't seemed liked he cared at all that there was theft in the hotel. Utterly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Check out was the best time of the week!”
Reviews.Author: BaltoMdBob_o
Reviews.Content: The walls are paper thin. You could hear everything through them clear as a bell. At 1:00 to say 2:00 am you get to hear every sentence that every drunk spoke as they walked to their rooms. The mattress felt as if it were full of rocks. I doubled up on a comforter and slept on the floor on carpet that was almost as old as what is in my grandparents’ house! I never tried the sofa bed, but the sofa creaked and sucked you in , in to the point that you really had to work to get up out of it. The sliding door to the balcony stuck. The drop ceilings are in terrible shape, rusted in the bathroom. In general,, the interior of our room was maintained by someone who thought that smearing on gobbs of caulk could fix anything! The kitchen-net is soo small that it is impossible to cook even the smallest of meals because there is NO counter space what so ever! The counter houses the sink and a two burner electric stove top, that’s it. There is a coffee maker and a toaster,, but the only electrical receptacles are you guessed it,, at the stove where there is no open counter top space to set anything! The pots and pans are in such bad shape, they would be rejected by the Good Will store! I tried to cook scrapple and eggs and everything stuck and burned! The TV’s were old, around 1990 I’d guess, the one in the living room had a picture area that was pinched inward from the left and right. That condition would come and go. All in all a very bad experience, we should have saved the points and just stayed at the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Booked 4 nights, left within 24 hours of check in”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: The stay started well enough, until we got to the room and realized they didn't vacuum the carpet or clean the mirrors in the bathroom. AC broke overnight and woke up sweating in an 80 degree room. Even when it worked with the drapes open to see the bay it never went under 75 and it was only 80 outside. Walls are paper thin, you can hear everything the people in the other rooms do. Floor is not level, the table wobbled back and forth due to this reason. 3 Electrical outlets didn't work, you would plug something in and it would just fall out of the socket. Drunks from the bar behind the hotel banged on door at 2 pm, we were on top floor, and manager "kyle" told me i had to understand there was a bar behind the hotel, as if that could happen every night. Because of all of these issues as well as the manager not giving any refunds no matter what you dealt with, this place is a joke. Paid for 4 nights and moved to the holiday inn 24 hours later. DO NOT BOOK HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Was decent.”
Reviews.Author: jbakerinc
Reviews.Content: I feel this hotel provided the bear min. The staff was friendly. The room was somewhat clean. My only issue would be the smell from the stagnant water of the bay right outside the window. but all in all a good time. They could use new fold out couches too..lol

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: SBJB32611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night and have no major complaints. Our room was clean and comfortable. You can tell that the room is dated but you can also tell that they are working on upgrading everything. The view of the bay was great, as well as the small balcony. We didn't pay an arm and a leg, but yet we were close to the beach, overlooking the bay in a one bedroom suite. My husband and I are looking forward to staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Aweful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah3777
Reviews.Content: Apparently it is acceptable for the housekeeping staff to make drug deals while working. Or maybe it is a second source of income for this hotel. I have two small children who thankfully were not with us. My husband and I overheard an extremely loud and foul mouthed housekeeper making a drug deal on her cellphone in the hallway on our floor. This is an outrage!! We will NEVER return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Purchased a 4 night stay from Groupon. I'll have to say the view of the bay was very nice, but that is about all I can say was above average. We normally like to cook breakfast each morning but it was almost inpossible in the small space available. While there was no skillet the staff did bring one up promptly along with some dishwashing liquid when contacted. The room was definitely aged. I won't say it was dirty, but it just wasn't kept up very well. Very little flow of water from the shower head. While the room did have a flat panel TV in the sitting area, it was very small ~26" or so. The couch needed to be replaced. When you sat down, you sank down into the cushions. Pretty worn out. Had to go to front desk to get change to wash clothes and they only had 3 quarters!! No other change to be had in the hotel. Again, the view was good and when we asked for a couple of items, they staff was helpful (except for getting change!) but I was a little disappointed in the room quality overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bay view!”
Reviews.Author: rsdani319
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here a few days ago due to a Groupon deal. Some of these reviews had me nervous about what I was going to get. However, my worries went virtually unfounded. The view from my unit 508 was gorgeous! The room was very nice. I had a one bedroom which has its own shutter doors to maintain privacy from the living room area. The bathroom was pretty big too and very clean. Nothing about this hotel was old looking or dirty. The staff was friendly and helpful. Make sure u check ur pull out sofa bed upon check in though. Ours was heavily soiled. Once we let them know though a completely new mattress was given to us in a reasonable time frame. Overall, this was more than a decent stay for the deal I got.

Reviews.Title: “Toilet didn't work, AC didn't work, No windows! Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Tina D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here this past week because we had purchased a groupon. I must say that we will never return. I'll start from the beginning, when we checked in everything seemed great. The hotel was beautiful from the outside, front desk employees were friendly and welcoming. We got to our room and it seemed nice enough. We hit the AC on and discovered to our dismay that it just plain didn't work. So we attempted to open some windows....and none of the windows open. They aren't broken, they just don't open. So then we opened the french doors that had sliding doors onto the balcony and the sliding doors just kept coming off the track. Infuriating. So we dealt with all of those things and went out to explore. When we returned it was rather late. My boyfriend used the bathroom and the toilet clogged. We went down to the front desk and they gave us a plunger. This would be fine if it only happened this one time but it happened this time and every time we used the bathroom following. Can I tell you how mortifying it is to have a maintenance man come in to fix your very clogged toilet on your vacation? This happened over and over and they just would give us a plunger or send maintenance. Finally the night before we left, I spoke to a manager and he gave us a new room. This was appreciated but having to move all of our stuff the night before we leave was super frustrating. When we got to the new room, there was working AC and a good set of screen doors but I don't think they had changed the sheets before we went in. I found multiple hairs on the sheets that were not ours. If we weren't leaving the next morning (it also was about 1am when i went to bed), I would have complained. Then I attempted to plug my phone in to charge, when I put the charger in the outlet it fell out. No joke. All of the outlets in the living room were too large. They had lamps that we could not even plug in. How does that happen?! Also, I wish when we had booked we would have known that the pool would not be open and that more than half of Ocean City is closed unless it's the weekend. There was very little for us to do. Even restaurants closed before 5pm. There was no room service or even vending machines (with the exception of soda) so if you were hungry after 5pm, good luck. Good things: the bedding was soft and comfortable, the view was beautiful but I'm sure during the summer it is probably very buggy (right over marshy land) and loud (across from Fagers Island). That's about it. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time!”
Reviews.Author: Patrice L
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit skeptical. But luckily, we had a fab time. The room was very clean and nice; comfortable bed. The view of the bay was pretty and the location was outstanding. Close to the beach and to Fager's Island. The staff was very courteous at all times. Unfortunately, we were too early for the pool, but it looked really nice. We will definitely stay here again when we come to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ald3114
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days last July and the location, pool, and view was great . It was across the highway about two blocks from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place :)”
Reviews.Author: Morgan A
Reviews.Content: Great Staff. Very friendly and helpfull. Clean rooms with great views of the bay! We really enjoyed our stay and plan on returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place and people!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy D
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the coconut Malorie a couple of times in the past, the most recent being a family reunion...most of the whole family also booked rooms and loved them also. The views are spectacular.....They employees are very nice and helpful and the rooms were nice and clean! I really can't imagine staying anywhere else now that we have found this place. I highly recommend it!! Sandra Shipe

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not the best!”
Reviews.Author: lilian24
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day weekend at the Malorie. Just needed a mini getaway. Overall, the hotel was ok, a little old but they tried to update it. The lobby was nice. The rooms are old & musty and need renovation. The hotel is located on 59th and coastal hwy so it's a bit far from the boardwalk. 2 blocks from the beach. Free parking. My husband and I got there Friday night around 10pm after driving 4 hours and we checked in right away. The front desk person was nice and helpful. Went up to our room, but the key didn't work. So my husband went down to the front desk and took about 15 minutes then maintenance came up with him to fix the door. However, that took what seemed to be an hour to fix. The guy kept trying and trying but it didn't seem to work. Finally, around 11:20pm the door was fixed and we were able to relax in our room. (That was a turnoff) Also, The following morning we were awakened to noise and talking outside of our door. a couple of people were having a conversation for about 20 minutes and we could hear everything. My husband and I were very irritated by that. So,I got up and went down to get coffee and I saw the housekeeping cart out side our door. Which leads me to assume it was the housekeeping staff that was socializing (but this is only an assumption). We stayed in the one bedroom suite, and like I said it need updating. It overlooked the bay. The bathroom was a decent size but the fixtures need replacing. There was a 30'' TV in the living room and a very old TV in the bedroom that had horrible picture. The bed was very uncomfortable to sleep on. It also had a fully equipped kitchenette which was nice to have. (we didn't use it much) The complimentary coffee in the lobby was from 7am-11am. It was actually very good. We had about a cup each day. We asked for late check-out (12pm) and it wasn't a problem. Check-out was simple. Overall, I wouldn't consider staying here again because I would like to be closer to the center of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Book Unit # 508 on the TOP FLOOR ! SUNSETS R GREAT ! Unit clean sleeps 4”
Reviews.Author: WantZBest
Reviews.Content: Not sure WHY other comments left for this resort were negative BUT I have to say our unit # 508 at Coconut Malorie ( TOP FLOOR ) was spotless, inviting, had a coffee tray stocked and waiting for us. The views from our private balcony was great overlooking Fagan's Island Restaurant, the sunset and water views was AWSOME from the unit # 508. We had Clean fluffy towels, comfy queen sized bedding, and 2 TV's with cable ! You can bring breakfast items to put in the fridge, a 2 burner stove top, dishes and there IS a table seats 4 to eat at. LOVED the unit and the management ! Very friendly place to stay ! Right off the 90th Street Bridge. There is even a workout room and a pool table and game room to enjoy on the upper levels with views.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Live Up To Its Potential”
Reviews.Author: artsletters
Reviews.Content: When we first stayed here twenty years ago, this was a first-rate resort. Over time, it hasn't aged well. We have stayed here one weekend, during the winter, for the last three years. This year, the heating system was so irregular that we either had to swelter in the bedroom, or freeze in the living room. The furniture has definitely seen better days. The sofa was so uncomfortable that two people couldn't sit on it at the same time. I don't know what it would be like to sleep on it. We really like the location; right over the lower bridge into OC, with nice views. Also, the hotel is within walking distance to Fager's Island Restaurant and Bar which is a premiere destination during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay in this overpriced dump again”
Reviews.Author: P B
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the place was horrible. The hotel prides itself on being an upscale resort, and it's disgusting. We booked 3 rooms. All 3 smelled like stale indian food. The smell of mold in the hallways was disgusting. One of our rooms was only half cleaned - bed left 1/2 made, kitchen sink left with rusty sponge and dishtowel in it and dishes not put away. Bathroom not cleaned, no toiletries in the bathroom. We were moved to another room which while it didn't have an idian food smell, stunk of mold. The water pressue in the rusted shower was awful. The hot water in the bathroom sink didn't turn off unless the knob was positioned in just the right spot. The cleaning that had been done on this room was sub par. I will never, ever go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Coconut Dump”
Reviews.Author: Charrier
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Malorie two times. The first time it was so so, we were using it as a crash pad for a week visit over Christmas. Since we weren't going to be there except to sleep it wasn't too terrible. However, the nightclub next door was very loud and it was difficult to sleep until after 2AM. The second time we stayed there the unit we had was a dump. The heat didn't work and oddly enough it snowed 12 inches in OC that week. We were so cold, we had to bunk in with family who lived nearby. The front desk and maintenance crew tried to fix the heat, but could only make it so the heat was on or off. So you could make the unit very warm turn it off manually wait until it got chilly and then turn it on again. Not fun when you would like to sleep. Additionally we could only get hot water in the bathroom - for an unexplained reason the hot water in the kitchen took 8 - 10 minutes to become room temp. It never got hot and when trying to wash dishes this was very unsanitary. We have decided not to stay at the Malorie ever again.

Reviews.Title: “If it is your Only choice”
Reviews.Author: pishihapoo
Reviews.Content: I don't want to review too bad of a review because my husband and I stayed here for free. We had won a raffle and we could choose from a variety of hotels. We chose the Coconut Malorie because it wasn't too far from the city (3 hours drive from D.C.) Unfortunately, I have to agree with the other reviewers. There is a very bad ant problem in this hotel (especially in the bathroom area/counters). We did report this problem to management and they didn't seem surprised. The entire hotel has a very musty/mildew smell. The workout room has a treadmill (probably from the 70's) and due to the musty smell in the area, it was hard to breathe while working out. Our room had a musty smell as well. There is a kitchenette but we were grossed out by all the rust around the appliances. We didn't dare to use any of the dishes/silverware that were in the cabinets. We opened the refrigerator and thankfully, it was clean to store some bottled water we had purchased. If you are getting this for less than $100/night , then it might be worth it. It is in a good location, faces the Bay (not the ocean) and it is within walking distance from 7-11 and other restaurants. We were thankful that our stay was only 2 days, so we didn't suffer too much. On a positive note, the staff is very nice so it made up for the bad hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: norma t
Reviews.Content: My son stayed here a couple of years ago and had a ant problem. During my resent stay, exiting from the elevator, the hallway had a nasty musky smell. Both rooms smelled worst. I constantly complained but was told that maybe the fake plants in the rooms were mildewed. Shocker, there were no live or fake plants in the rooms. Not only were the rooms funky, they only partially cleaned them one time in seven days. The partial cleaning included changing the towels/washcloths, taking out the trash and making the bed without changing the sheets. Yes, we have to sleep on the same sheets for 6 nights. Which I thought was just plain nasty!!! If clean towels were needed, you had to remember to call the front desk. Very inconvenient. I will never stay again or advise anyone else to stay. Hated it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - good location”
Reviews.Author: sthompsen
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place with a great bay view. We had a studio unit which was all we needed for a long weekend get -a- way. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was good - near beach and dining. Only downside was there was early morning noise from Fagar's bar near-by...but since we enjoyed the place ourselves we didn't mind too much :) we are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The place was great and we would definitely go back...”
Reviews.Author: letsgetgoing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a studio. It was a timeshare trade through RCI. I read some of the reviews and was concerned about the place. When I got there, I was completely surprised. First, the front desk. The people are not rude, they are Russian, and I am not saying that in a bad way. I found out, as you go through Ocean city, the boardwalk, the restaurants, everywhere, there is a Russian exchange for the summer. These people are here learning to work. Learning the language, and let's face it, they are not what Americans expect. So their personalities are just different than ours. So I found no problems once you started talking to them, or asking for assistance. Overall they were nice people at the front desk and pretty much everywhere throughout the city. We had a studio apartment. It was huge compared to what I expected. Nice comfortable bed, small living room hide a bed and a dining room set. Also a kitchenette with a full fridge and microwave. The bathroom was huge with a jetted tub. And not once did we run out of water. We were overlooking the pool and the pool was great also. Every morning the maintenance people were out testing and vacuuming the pool. I was also amazed at the maid service every day. Typically with a timeshare swap, you get towel change once a week. But they were there every day. There really is no activity at the resort. They have a huge lobby that is pretty much just for decoration. Nothing planned that I could see. So you have to use Ocean City as your activitiy and I am sure you should have no problem doing that. The beach is right across the street, about a 5 minute walk and you can rent umbrellas and chairs for the day. Overall, we would go back. This is a fantastic place for all ages. If you want to party, there are plenty of bars and bands. If you have kids, the beach and the boardwalk are fantastic. One thing I would recommend, is make some of your own meals. The dinners are not cheap there. They are good, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, old and desperate need update (not worth for $240 a night)”
Reviews.Author: Win B
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the female staff did not even say hi. She had a stone face not even smile. She talked so low and we did not even hear it at all. It was late afternoon, the hotel was not busy at all. People who worked in a funeral home is more friendly than her. We had a family of 4. A Queen size bed for the parents and a so called fold out sofa. I fought it will collapsed any minute. The so called kitchen is a counter top type. A broken handle refrigerator, the bottom of the refrigerator is rusty. It took forever to boil a quart of water on the electric stove. The AC vent is very loud and sounds like a garbage truck and it had mold outside the wall. The furniture is a sticky, old bamboo wood. One of the review is right, it has a smell when you get into the lobby. The bathroom floor has stain, 2 light bulbs is quite dangling, the towel is old and has holes. My rag in the house is newer than them. We request an extra pillow. No one bring it up for 5 hours but the cleaning lady is very nice. We only had one tiny soap of 2" x 2" for the sink and the shower. One thing is good is, we had a beautiful view. The balcony is for 2 people standing room only. The pool is clean. No way we will come back and spent $240 a night there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place and staff”
Reviews.Author: paul z
Reviews.Content: The resort was nothing like the reviews I read on 7/30/2011 prior to visiting the resort to experience for myself. I guess everybody has a different opinion and needs. My family and I were called by first name by the front desk staff even after check-in . The staff was friendly and made us feel like home. They even suggested restuarants to eat and places to have fun wiothout us asking for the information. The housekeeping staff we came across were very friendly as well. Our room was cleaned daily and deodorized. The gym in the tower and billiards room were excellent. My kids love it. Well, i just wanted to share my wonderful experience. It seems to me only the few bad experiences should not overshadow the work the wonderful manager and staff a doing at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: daddysgirl18998
Reviews.Content: We loved our resort! the room was clean, the staff friendly and helpful! we will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephangel
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Ocean City, I have stayed at the Coconut Malorie. The last 3 times was great. This past time shows that all the bad reviews are true. Our room smelled like cat urine, the remote would not operate the DVD player. Then just stopped working with our DVD stuck inside. The lights in the bathroom were hanging out with the wires showing. The security lock did not work. When I called downstairs no one would pick up the phone. I could go on and on.... This room was definitely not worth $240.00 a night. This used to be my go to hotel in OC with great memories, but I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: meliss1110
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on the site, my hope were not particularly high for this hotel. We went through a timeshare exchange. I agree with other reviewers in that the whole place needs a paint job - small cracks in the floor, mildew on ceiling, old bathrooms. Hotel staff appeared to be overwhelmed with the questions I asked about restaurants, mileage to get to the boardwalk (on 27th St), etc. Lobby 2 computers were more helpful in finding this information... Pool was small, but pleasantly maintained. Bar was unattended during our stay. Fager's Island next door was convenient with good bar food and great views of the bay. Assateague island/Chicoteague Island was a beautiful experience. We saw wild ponies and dolphins during our boat trip. Some money should be spent to train staff appropriately and upgrade the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Before Reaching”
Reviews.Author: the_oneils
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few years back with my husband and I and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Unfortunately, we didn't even make it beyond an initial reservation. The service in just trying to reach someone was HORRIBLE. Everytime I called the 24 hour reservation/customer service line I would have to hang up and call back 4 or 5 times before reaching someone (and this was on about 3 different occassions). That coupled with the very poor reviews changed my mind. Luckily, there were no penalites and instead chose to stay at Francis Scott Key which the kids loved!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Not That Fancy”
Reviews.Author: CulturalHomestay
Reviews.Content: I was connected to hotel reservations from the Enterprise Car Rental page. I thought I had made a reservation for Holiday Inn Express, but ended up booking at this place. The cost per night is $159.00. Yes, the lobby area is beautiful and the hotel room rather nice. But our shower water was cold within a few minutes of showering, the water leaked from the wall in the bathroom into the dining area. The screen on the balcony was torn so it was not possible to open the French doors to let cool bay air into the room. And the sleeper sofa mattress was stained with yellow spots. On top of that, they don't serve breakfast and the checkout time is 10 am. For a little bit less I could have stayed at Holiday Inn Express, had a later check out time and breakfast included. When I called the front desk twice to have someone come up and look into the cold water situation and the floor leak, no one showed. I mentioned my displeasure at checkout. I was told the manager would call me. The manager never did. There are better places to stay. They are obviously undergoing renovations right now and hopefully things will improve.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot believe Wyndham is in anyway associated with this excuse for a hotel/resort.”
Reviews.Author: Tykesha
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Ocean City for a nice, quiet weekend getaway this past weekend. We booko the Coconut Malorie through my Wyndham Time share. The Coconut Malorie is the only resort Wyndham has in that area. The concierge at the front desk hardly spoke English and the little she did speak was used to be rude to a elderly couple and myself after asking a simple question about local restaurants. The poor customer service aside, the hotel reeked of mold and cheap hotel soap. When we got to the room we discovered that the toilet had not been cleaned and had a ring of mildew around inside of it. Two of the lights in the vanity were broken. One just didnt work and the other was hanging out of the mirror with exposed wires. The jets in the tub were rusted. And the side of the tub looked as if someone had punched a hole in it and the hotel had done a botched job of patching it up. The headboard looks like it had been broken and glued back togther. The comforter had white spots on it. There was blond hair all over the floor. The dishes were dirty. The lock on the door did not work. The "balcony" was only large enough for one person to stand on at a time. There is not WIFI throughout the hotel. If you are interested in using the Internet, you have to actually sit in the lobby. I am an advid international traveler and I have stayed in hostels that were cleaner and more posh than this place. I would not stay here again if even if it were free. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room ...but....the service....not so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: saul102294
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip on hotel.com the day before traveling and were Looking for an inexpensive room with a Jetted tub for a romantic weekend. Front desk couldn't find reservation & then took someone else’s room for us (good for us but not for the other traveler). The room would be nice if you were spending a week or more since there was a fridge, stove, microwave, dishes, silverware etc. You could definitely save some money by eating in a few times. Small ant problem (due to the in-room kitchen) was not tragic but made me feel like other things may not be as clean as they looked. Other minor inconveniences included; no way to cool the room (fan would only work on heat) and the Hot/Cold directions were reversed from what the faucet said. There was a beautiful pool table room on the 6th floor & Exercise / Ping Pong on the 7th floor but you had to get the balls from the front desk & they were already checked out (even though no one was in either room playing)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: PS_1968
Reviews.Content: We had good stay, the location is great and the hotel nice. Rooms seemed to be renovated not long ago but furniture is dated. Service people checked daily if we needed anything and changed towels and linens regularly. Front desk could do better. Overall, compared to other locations in Ocean City, the place is not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: ToesNdeSand
Reviews.Content: The sunsets from the back bay view rooms are absolutely breath taking. The property has been well maintained and is very clean. The staff was friendly, the manager Keeba was a hoot! I'll definitely be back. The fact that it's so close to Fager's is a plus too!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again. Just disguisting. :(”
Reviews.Author: Joryan2006
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at this hotel was horrible from day 1. There was a damp and moldy smell in the room that never went away. When we asked about it, the staff gave us a can of Lysol and said to spray it ( only made it worst). At 12:30 am my daughter used the bathroom and flush once just to have the toilet over flow. We called the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do until 8am in the morning. They came up with bath towels to put on the floor, which did not help. When I woke up at 5am I had to walk in toilet water to get to bathroom. We asked for fresh towels and was told that they were washing them now and as soon as they were dry they would bring them up ( 2 1/2 hrs later). The bathtub was clog and dirty.The fridge had rust on it which they paint over. There were stains on the walls, the carpet, and old 1980's couch. On our last night we were awaken to the fire alarm at 4:45 am and rush outside. There was no fire. They said it may have been someone smoking. Then just as we get upstairs and put the kids back in bed. the fire alarm goes off again. The staff never apologized and when we asked for a different room they said none was available.They gave us two nights free which we will Never use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: serg94
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, this hotel boasts some spectacular views of the bay. Our room overlooked Fagers Island, a hot spot once the sun sets. The room was a one BR suite on the 5th floor, standard for this hotel (i think). The noise from the shared hallway that leads to your room carries directly into the bedroom. On two consecutive nights we had different neighbors who woke us up after their night out. The room had a damp smell and the air vents were dirty. Other than these issues, the place was OK. Value ratings would be higher if they addressed some of the quality issues and paying less than $150/weekday. Ameneties incl an outdoor pool, fitness room, pool table and ping-pong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hollyalzitoon
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Coconut from July 2-9 and I was not dissapointed. This is our second stay. This time we had a studio, last time we had a one bedroom unit. Both are similar size. Our room was cleaned nicely everyday. Whenever we needed extra towels, coffee, soap...housekeeping was there quickly. Staff was always working very hard. Beds were soft and comfy. Our 15 year old slept on the pull out couch and it was surprisingly comfy too. Room temperature/ air conditioning worked great, infact we had to turn it off during the night. Beautiful bay view. The staff had a nice little bbq by the pool on the 4th of July....free hotdogs and hamburgers and cold drinks. If I had one tiny complaint..the a/c in the workout room was not so great but the view from the top of the building made up for it. We will stay there again 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Does anything ever dry in this place?”
Reviews.Author: nancypohl
Reviews.Content: For the most part, this place isOK. All of the rooms are the same, so they're a little on the small side. The kitchen is a two-burner stovetop and if they're all like ours, it had two heat settings - high and close to high. The phones in the rooms are not turned on so you can't call the front desk unless you call from an outside line, and there are three phones in each unit. Why? The housekeeping people are happy to make the bed, not change the sheets, and they'll bring fresh towels, but we never got enough for the four of us (and I only mean one each) without asking twice or getting the towels off the cart ourselves. They never cleaned the floors or the bathroom during the week we were there. The dampness was really annoying. I don't think the AC is really AC. I think they just have it set so the fans blow bringing in the humidity from outside. The room gets cool enough, but nothing ever dries and the room smelled musty. I'm surprised they don't have a serious black mold problem. The sunset over the bay was gorgeous every night and the place is very quiet. The hotel is two blocks from the beach, which is not what we were told when I called to inquire about some particulars. We were also told we could only have two key cards, that if more were made they would cancel out the first two. The man I assume is the front desk manager overheard that and helped so we could each have a key. The fitness center was pretty much a joke and the Internet is only available in the lobby. Who wants to sit in the lobby? I never went to the pool, but my husband and son said it was small and older but clean. Served its purpose. I wouldn't mind staying at this place again, but I would hope the dampness problem would be taken care of by then.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: frieda47
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay through Wyndham at this resort, and we were not pleased in the least. The balconies are a joke, as there is only enough room to stand out on them. I love to sit out and have my morning coffee on prior vacations. The pool and hot tub were not filled and open. The computer access was slow and not running properly. The staff wasn't available at the desk several times during our stay, and our unit had ants in it. This was our once and done vacation to Ocean City. Would not go back there or to the Coconut Malorie again.

Reviews.Title: “good place for money!”
Reviews.Author: lindapm1
Reviews.Content: Had the hotel suite that comes with kitchenette. balcony, and jacuzzi tub. PLace was very clean and the maids clean our room everyday. Sun set is beautiful from the balcony. staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Off season”
Reviews.Author: epicurianfairies
Reviews.Content: It was off season and nothing was open in the area, except for a couple of resturants. The pool wasn't open at the resort and the night life sucked. We heard the area was hoppin when its in season, but all out boring if its off season. Hotel didnt have any amenities accept a pool which they didnt notify us that was closed.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Thanks2Calvary
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed several times at Coconut Malorie and all our experiences were pleasant. The motel room is roomy, clean, and comfortable. It is located on bay side (Isle of Wright) with breath taking sunset views. The location is great. Just walk two easy blocks to the beach for the enjoyment of the Atlantic Ocean or drive a few miles, park and enjoy the Boardwalk. Some complain about oders, but we have not experience any. Please remember, all rooms everywhere have some oders near the bay or ocean, it just goes with the area. Flager's isand is right behind the motel and a popular night spot. I think if you stay, your experience will be good, ours was.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't even stay more than one night!”
Reviews.Author: Mish P
Reviews.Content: We chose the Thanksgiving package which gave us a dinner at the resturant next door and 2 nights for a set price. We went to celebrate our 1yr wedding anniversary and it was not something positiviely memorable. My husband and I both ended up with food poisioning. We were told the pool was open until December 1. When we got there it was empty!! It was a 70+ temperature when we got there and it had been. They had turned off the AC and the fan in the room didn't work. When we called about the fact that it was 89degrees in the room we were told "just deal our ac is off" The room smelled it was very very dirty!! The small kitchen area was filthy and the dishes in it were food covered. The tub was broken and cracked!! They didn't change the sheets and when we told them we were cancelling our second reservation which would have been for 3 days added to our package they were not going to refund us. It was 24hours prior and we told them about how we were treated and they didn't care. We called our credit card company from the lobby and told them we were disputing the charge if it appeared because we would not be staying! They then refunded us the remainder and tried to offer us free cookies! We met a couple who had asked for a bay view room and the only "bay view" they had was the hotel named the Bay view next door!! They were also checking out since they had booked almost a year in advance.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: doubdd
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to OC and I searched the web countless of times looking for an afforable and nice place to stay. I wasnt disapoointed in the least with our room. We had a one bedroom over looking fager's island. I wont disagree with the last person, yes the carpets and elevators could use a cleaning, Our room did have a slight oder ,but it was disinfectant and soon went away, otherwise the room was clean and appealing to the eye. I would come here again and have no qualms.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Much a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: cjd219
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coconut Malorie for two nights during the last week in August 2009 at a very reasonable room rate. We were drawn to this hotel after viewing photos on their website of what portrayed an upscale hotel with beautiful furnishings and pool. We are so glad that we did not pay peak season rates for this disappointing hotel! Upon check in, we found the lobby to be fairly nice but the elevator was filthy and the carpet in the dark hallways looked dirty. When we opened the door to our room, a strong odor appeared to come from the kitchenette area so we searched the fridge and garbage for rotting food but didn't find anything. We opened the windows to air out the room hoping that it would make the smell go away. Then we noticed the walls had food splatters on them in various places throughout the room and the white ceiling had turned black in a large area near the air/heat vent. Gross. It's probably safe to assume the ducts have not been cleaned in years so breathe at your own risk. The sofa, area rug, and seat cushions were all very stained and worn. The smell of garbage did not go away so we asked to be moved to another room. The friendly front desk person agreed to move us. We found the next room to have a strange smell, but it was more bearable. The furnishings were still wornout and the 80's style lights around the bathroom mirror made it too hot, but at least the shower was nice. We believe this hotel could be great if it was cleaned better, re-painted and given some new furniture. It is not a horrible beach hotel, but not nearly as nice as the website portrays ....and it is stretching it to call this place a "resort" without a restaurant or bar on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: cmedemaio
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I accidently found the coconut malorie upon going to the 7-11 because we were trying to find a hotel since the hotel we were staying at messed up our reservations. We called and were told that we will have a bayside room with a stove, fridge, micro-wave. Upon arriving just walking in to the hotel was beautiful with the staircase and the waterfall. check in was VERY easy and we had the top floor .. when we walked into the room we were in amazement! The living room had a dining table, a nice sofa beautiful tile floor, and an excellent view! We were in astonishment because we only paide 180 for the room, and it was incredible .. we then went further to look on, and we found a tiled bathroom with a large jacuzzi bathtub, and the mirror with lightbulbs going down the side. It was like we were watching scarface! I couldnt find the bedroom but then my boyfriend opened these large doors which led us into a spacey room, with a large closet- extra pillows, blanket, and an iron! The towels actually went all the way around my body and they weren't tiny, like most hotels, and there were FOUR towels! The view was also amazing. 7-11 is right down the street and you can walk there at 1am for taquitos! On the down side, check out is at 10 am, while check in is at 4 pm. If you are staying on the bay side, you will here the club/restaraunt until atleast 1am. But the balcony was atleast 60ft from our bedroom, so we couldnt hear it from the living room. The hotel is pretty far from the boardwalk, but it was easy enough to pay 10$ for the day to park in a parking lot. In the long run you are saving yourself money. I would DEFINATELY RECOMMEND this hotel to everyone that stays in OC. The price is unbeatable for the quality you are getting!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service/Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: bigal412
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coconut Malorie for a wedding, as did most of the guests. Check in was 45 minutes late which is ridiculous for a hotel that has check-out at 10AM and check-in at 4PM. Even though they had six hours to get the rooms ready, they were still late and when we finally did get into the rooms, they were not fully cleaned. The bathroom had sand all over the floor and tub, there were crumbs on the rug and all over the pull-out sofabed, which also had old urine and blood stains. Gross! There was a slightly musty smell. It took several requests to get anything you needed and the staff, while smiley, was not helpful at all. It rained all weekend and they closed the pool because of the threat of thunderstorms (with that logic, you'd need to close the pool until October!). They did have a room and a pool table and chess board, which looked like it may have been nice a few years ago but the musty smell from the old, moldy books and furniture is so strong that it's basically unbearable. It was a good thing there was a 7-Eleven up the street because the vending machines were out of anything we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites !”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazy85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in december. The suite had a living room with a dining table, a bathroom with a whirlpool tub and a bedroom. There were 2 TV's and a small kitchen. The kitchen was fully equipped with silverware/pots/dishes/stove/microwave. You can order food from outside the hotel and get it delivered to your door too! OVerall this hotel is very nice and worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it once was”
Reviews.Author: Detravelmom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Coconut Malorie about 4 times in the last 10 years, and have watched the hotel steadily decline. This week was booked through RCI exchange as was our previous trips. Pros: Nice location and the rooms have a nice view of the bay. Free wi fi internet in the lobby, and one computer for guest use in the lobby. Kitchenette adequate enough to cook a few meals in. Full size refrigerator. Coin operated washer/dryer on each floor. Cons: The halls, lobby and room had a musty smell. The room itself was so bad I had to go out and buy plug-ins to overcome the smell. I also bought lysol and sprayed down the sofa, carpet and drapes. This helped make things bearable. I could say that maybe we just got a bad room, but when the hallways and common areas are just as smelly, it makes me think the whole hotel is that way. You can hear the noise of traffic coming in and out of the nightclub behind the restaurant, till very late, especially if you have an end room. At night the hall lights are pretty dim so it can be a little creepy coming back to your room after dark. The towels were thin and the blanket had a hole in it, while the sheets were patched in places and thin. The game room is nothing more than a library with a pool table in it. The fitness room is upstairs past that, and has a few machines (treadmill, eliptical, bike). The website pictures are very misleading, the room shown is of the presidential suite which is not available to timeshare owners, just those willing to pay for it on a day to day basis. While this is a timeshare resort, it still operates as a hotel, and it seems like they cater more to the hotel visitors than the timeshare ones. Some of the other reviews here have more accurate pictures of the rooms. Overall it's a shame that what was once what I would consider a 4 star hotel has fallen so far. Unless the hotel makes improvements in their rooms, I probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO not use the 800# or you will be charged Long distance rates”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerYork_PA
Reviews.Content: In September we plan to visit Ocean City for a brief stay and I was checking on hotel prices. Call the 800# listed on this website 1-800-767-6060 and made several calls because we were negotiating on rates and dates but sometimes on hold for a while. Since it was an 800# I did not feel concerned about the wait on hold. Then I get my phone bill this month and I have over $29.00 worth of charges for long distance calls to a phone number that I did not recognize. It was 1-410-723-6100. When I called the number it was the "Coconut Malorie". This is false advertizement of a toll-free 1-800-number and then they charge the customer for the calls. By reading the reviews on this it is just one more reason I would NOT recommend contacting this hotel for you next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay At This Place - no matter what.”
Reviews.Author: Dontstay
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to begin. Maybe the fact that when you call the hotel to make a reservation you have to leave a message and someone calls you back in 24 hours?! That should have been my first clue. Then when we had to pay in advance (upon check-in) for the entire amount of our three-day stay thought it was odd but... after seeing the room they were smart to collect up front. There was other people's hair on the floor, clearly the bathroom floor hadn't been really cleaned in years, if ever. Same with the bottom of the tub. The bathroom towels had holes in them and had me wondering if I was cleaner prior to the shower?! The comforter on the bed must have been 30 years old without ever being cleaned. The couch in the room was so old I would never sit on it - very dirty and something you would see on the side of a road with a FREE sign hanging on it. The area rug in the middle of the room needed to be thrown in a dumpster without hesitation. My husband walked around in white socks for 5 minutes and they were black with dirt. After that, we walked around in slippers/flip flops at all times, even to go to the bathroom at night since the floors were so disgusting. They say they had a kitchen in the room, if you dare use it. The refrigerator was rusted out and lets just say you don't want to cook there (didn't want to sleep in the room let alone EAT in it). And forget a good night's sleep even if you can look past the dirt since Fager's Night Club had music so loud you couldn't sleep until 2 a.m. or after on Fri/Sat. The people leaving the club were so loud that until 3 a.m. we were kept awake and then the garbage truck came at 6 or 7 a.m. and woke us up again. In an attempt to escape the filth of the room, we tried sitting by the pool. However, there were bugs at the pool that made it so you couldn't sit out there and I think you would be crazy to get into the pool for fear of how long it has been since perhaps it was properly cleaned and tested/treated chemically. During our 3 night stay there were maybe 4 people I saw who worked there, rarely saw a cleaning cart/person cleaning the room, etc. They are clearly under staffed or not willing to pay people to keep the place up. Anyone who wrote that they thought it was great for the money clearly hasn't traveled much or doesn't at least have some very basic standards that need to be met prior to giving a positive review - I would never return to OC or to the Coconut Malorie ever - even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: G0vt_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very worried with the reviews noting mold/bugs, etc. However, my family enjoyed our stay at Coconut Malorie. We had an RCI exchange, stayed in a Studio Unit facing the Bay. Got a bit tight for 4, but enjoyed the beautiful view, well maintained room, adequately clean (and I'm a clean freak), very functional kitchenette, Wi-Fi, very little balcony but enough to enjoy the sunset. Supposedly a billards table and excersice equipment on the 5th floor but I never checked it out. Daily maid service with fresh towels, complimentary coffee supplied. Great location near the Rt 90 bridge...right in the middle of the OC strip. Enjoyed being able to walk to Fager's for dinner/drinks. Yes you can hear the dumpsters in the morning, but you can also lightly hear the bands at night and their classic 1812 overture at sunset. I thought it was pretty cool to be able to walk to this OC tradition. Pool was heated and kids enoyed it...the deck needs refurbishment and there were often complaints about no towels...but we brought our beach towels so didn't bother me. Lobby was nicely furbished, complimentary coffee and 2 computers with internet access. Lobby area did always feel humid and on one occasion smelled a little musty after it rained..think they have a HVAC issue there. We had a fire drill one morning, likely related to maintenance work on the 2nd floor. There was a wedding held there too, but it was no inconvienence for us. Must have had them all on a different floor. Overall, this placed surpassed my expectations and made for a pleasant family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy & Mildewy in OCMD”
Reviews.Author: SunAndSeaAndSand
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the week at the Coconut Malorie in Ocean City, MD. Let me start by saying that we are timeshare owners with Fairfield. I had an active search going with RCI for at least five years trying to book a week of vacation at the Coconut Malorie ... finally success, and I was so excited. About 2 weeks prior to check in I started researching things to do in Ocean City when I came across some reviews of the Coconut Malorie on trip advisor. I was shocked and disappointed to learn about the mold issues. Because I am highly allergic to mold, I promptly called the resort, and my fears were put to rest by the hotel staff. Still, I was a little hesitant. Upon entering the lobby for check in, I was certain that the reviews were accurate. The entire lobby smelled stale and moldy ... I was dredding what I would find in the room (208). The room was terrible. Mold on the walls and the ceilings near the air vents. The refrigerator was disgusting, and I was worried for my health. Being the optimist, my husband thought we should give it one night and see how we felt in the morning. The next day we changed rooms to the first floor (109). The room was still a little moldy, but nowhere near as bad as the first room. In hindsight, we should have called RCI and demanded our deposit back. This almost ruined our vacation. Outside of the mold issue, the pool area was pretty pathetic. It looked like at some point it had a pool bar ... but no longer. The hot tub looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years, and I was horrified when I saw people actually get in it. We did not have an issue with sales calls as indicated in other reviews because we unplugged our phones. (my daughter like to play with the phones). The other reviews that spoke of the 8am wake up call by the trash truck at Fager's Island is accurate and surprisingly loud! I will say that the front desk worker that handled finding us another room was very attentive to my health concerns with the mold. She even coordinated maintenance to help me move my luggage because my husband was unavailable for a few hours. Something tells me she has had a lot of experience dealing with mold complaints. We will never stay here again, and I will always consult trip advisor before booking with our timeshare again. RCI needs to reconsider if this should be classified as a 'Gold Crown Resort.' For other Fairfield/RCI owners, the best resorts we've stayed at in our 8 years of being owners are Seawatch Plantation in Myrtle Beach and the resort in Daytona Beach. They are top notch and deserve the 'Gold Crown Rating.'

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Ohio47
Reviews.Content: As an Fairfield resort owner, we selected this place through RCI. Based on the Gold Crown rating we had reasonable expectations. The rooms we were shown were small, there was mold in the bathroom and the refrigerators had bugs. We were shown three different rooms. We refused to stay here and contacted RCI. Thankfully they refunded our deposit and we stayed at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price”
Reviews.Author: shosha268
Reviews.Content: Listen people it sounds like all the people that wrote bad reviews about this place have never stayed at the Maryland or Jersey shore before. I have stayed in dumps at the shore for more money than this. Granted, they were usually directly on the beach but this place is nowhere near a dump. I also know what a nice hotel is after staying in Hyatt's allover the world and other worldclass resorts, this is not one of those but for a family vacation at the shore this was more than adequate. The room was clean and big. The efficiency was all new appliances and also very clean. Overall it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Logan31
Reviews.Content: I just got home from the Coconut Malorie and had a great time. I told my husband that we should check out the reviews when we got home. I was so shocked with the negative reviews. We decided to go to OC MD at the last minute, and booked this hotel on the drive down. I was scared that I did not do any research on the hotel prior to check in, but when I pulled in I was glady suprised. I thought the price for the hotel was average compared to all the other hotels. The management allowed us to check in early, and upgraded us to the presidential suite. The room was absolutely amazing! It was large with a living room, kitchen & bedroom with a nice whirltub. The views were great with the ocean and bay. Fagers (which was recomended at the front desk) was fun and the food was great. The pool was small with a lot of kids playing, it would of been nice if they had a roped off area for adults. I would defintely recomend the presidential suite!

Reviews.Title: “Some "Resort" ! Last Resort Maybe......”
Reviews.Author: BKN920
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this pricey "resort" as part of a wedding party. We tried to keep positive and upbeat but the hotel pushed even this optimist to the limits! First of all The Coconut Malorie describes itself as a resort , Resort translates to self contained....there was no restaurant or bar on site and the excercise equipment only worked part of the time. The vending machines were empty on all floors. Thank goodness there was a 7-Eleven near by! Better pack a lunch if you plan to stay here. The web site stated there were "beverages by the pool"...didn't see any and in fact the area where beverages might have been served looked like it hadn't been used for quite some time. Our bed sheets were only changed once during our 4 night stay and then we had to beg the staff to change them. Once they were changed the sheets had an old "prickly" feel - hmmm, could that have been on purpose? The sunsets were pretty however and the view of the bay was nice (don't open the patior doors - the stench is overwhelming!) I got the impression the staff just didn't care at all. I have to commend them in one area however. They charge your entire stay at check-in. Very crafty and smart indeed, otherwise guests might refuse to pay or request a discount upon checking out. Tip for the managers: Pay a bit more attention to your quests "concerns", give the hotel some TLC and The All New Coconut Malorie might live up to the name. In the meantime future travelers - Beware !

Reviews.Title: “Wildly Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JCB57
Reviews.Content: Knew this was not going to be a quality hotel, but was surprised at how 'un-quality' it was. The staff at night could not answer questions, I was put on hold several times and just forgotten, and one time they just told me to call later. The dayshift people had the appearance of staff who simply did not care - about anything. The checkout times seem early - 10 AM, the room came with one small pillow for the bed, the elevator moved glacially, the parking lot could not hold all the cars, and there was a swamp right outside my small small small patio that kept me from ever opening the window due to the rotten smell coming in (I had to laugh at their ads talking about how I would enjoy the fresh ocean breezes). All in all, not a place I would recommend. Apparently the term 'resort' is used loosely nowadays - there was no restaurant, no bar, no exercise room (at least one I could find), and nothing else that would constitute a resort in a conventional way. AND ALL this for JUST $250 a night...

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back - the negative reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: whoPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there last weekend (May 16-18, 2008) and it was the only place where I could find an opening due to the popular Cruiser's Weekend. I booked the couple's package for an extra $150 and it was NOT worth it!! A half dozen yellow roses in the room, some coupons to lunch ($20 off) and dinner ($50 off) at Fager's island and some muffins/OJ in the fridge.... dinner at Fager's was good, but we essentially paid the full price of the meal with the cost of the couple's package (and then some!) So definitely skip that if you are desperate enough to need to book a room here. On to the room... it was TERRIBLE, especially considering the price!! I have stayed in many Hiltons, Marriotts, Embassy Suites for roughly the same price per night and NEVER have I seen such a state of disrepair in a hotal room. The cabinets drawers in the kitchenette were old and misaligned .... same in the bathroom where one handle was completely broken off. Several shower curtain hooks were broken and missing, the bath towels were so old - they actually had HOLES in them (!!), the caning on the chairs in the living room was pulled off, the tile floor near the balcony was chipped and missing huge chunks (making barefoot walking hazardous). The bedroom dresser was missing several drawer pulls, the paint in all of the rooms was dirty and chipped in many places, and the fitted sheet on the bed looked and felt like it was 15 years old - not smooth, but "picky" and falling apart - I slept on top of the flat sheet. The extra blanket in the closet smelled like sour milk. Overall, I can't believe that management can actually ignore such minor fixes that make all the difference in the quality of a stay for a guest. It is true, as others have written - they have a beautiful lobby and one of the workers was re-painting the curb on the day we left. Why not pay some attention to the GUEST ROOMS?? They actually had the nerve (standing in the beautiful lobby and handing out free wine) to ask if we would sit through a 1 1/2 hour "spiel" on buying one of their timeshare units. You couldn't get me to agree to that even if the units were free! I respect my family and friends too much to ever allow them to set foot in this place again! Oh and beware.... again unlike any other place I've stayed ..... Coconut Malorie charges your credit card at Check In - not Check Out! They had charged us for the first night even before we had arrived! I was so disgusted upon our checkout, (yes the early 10:00 am) I couldn't even bring myself to voice the issues. Had the naive checkout girl asked about the quality of our stay (obviously they don't care to know because she didn't ask), I would have blasted the poor girl. Instead I decided to write and post my first ever review online to validate the other bad reviews. I was hoping and praying they were written by some very finicky folks, which I am not usually, but after spending so much $$ for NOTHING, I am so irritated with myself that I didn't heed the warnings of the other reviewers (BTW - I will print this and mail it to the Coconut Malorie). Overall, my hubby and I did have a nice weekend in OC and surpisingly we enjoyed Cruiser's Weekend and seeing all of the old restored cars driving up and down the main drag. We had some good food, good weather and fun walking the boardwalk. The Coconut Malorie was the ONLY negative - thank goodness we didn't spend much time in the room. We will likely return to OC, MD, but will definitely book at the Hilton or some other hotel that actually cares about their guests and show it in the quality and upkeep of the ROOMS. If ever faced with the same situation and the Coconut Malorie being the last place with an open room in all of Ocean City, I would opt to STAY HOME!

Reviews.Title: “coconut malorie”
Reviews.Author: laurelspringer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Malorie but, staff is not very friendly and it was hard to contact the hotel by phone for any answers to book a date. Finally we used the computer and they contacted us. We liked the walkway to Fagers Island where we ate our lunch one day. (really nice) The Malorie overlooks the bay and is very pretty. (you have to ask for a room that does though) They have an outdoor pool which is kept nice. We went in Sept07 which is a great time to buy crabs and eat in one night. We were told by someone that lived in MD that you get better and larger crabs when you purchase them by the dz and eat them at your hotel. The all you can eat crabs are smaller and not as good. We are going back the end of August this year again. Bahama Mamas for crabs!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Kinch417
Reviews.Content: Attracted by the pictures on the property's web page and talking to the staff I actually did something I usually don't and booked before checking here for reviews (knowing that I still had time to cancel if I wanted to). I was amazed to see such divergent reviews. Usually there's always one person whose only purpose, it seems, is to write a bad review just because the property has a lot of good ones. The review titled "Watch out for bed bugs" scared me enough to contact the hotel via email. I got a response the same day and was satified that the property had properly addressed the situation. So off we went. The property is located 1 block from the beach and about 30 blocks from the boardwalk. The lobby is very nice and has 2 computers with internet access which guests can use for free. There is also free coffee available for guests 24/7. The entire property is SMOKE-FREE and there is a HEFTY fine of $500 if you indulge. Other amenities include a small pool and a tower which has a pool table, a library, a ping pong table and a workout room. While we were waiting to check in we overheard two other guests complaining about their room. After hearing them we expected the negative reviews might be correct. When we got to our room we went through it with a fine tooth comb and especially checked for bed bugs (there were none). We wrote down a list of things that were problems, but not 'deal breakers' and called the front desk. They sent maintenance and housekeeping to our room to address the problems and with only a few more problems arising later which were, again, addressed, we continued our stay. We had a one bedroom with a pull-out sofa for our teenager. The room has 2 TVs, and a DVD player with the TV in the living area. It also included a small balcony, a whirlpool tub and a very new and clean kitchenette with a microwave. We also had a nice view of the bay. A small bridge takes you to Fager's Island restaurant. The staff was very nice. The trash truck, does, indeed come early in the morning to Fager's Island, and does make a lot of noise. The walls of the room are thin enough that we could hear people talking within, I'd guess, about 20 ft. of our room. *** I think it should be said that the property is not exactly a hotel in the normal since of the word. It seems the Coconut Malorie is a hybrid of a hotel, a time-share and a condo. We were approached by a salesman connected with the property who tried to get us see a 'demo' about the property "and find out more about us". We didn't take him up on his offer (timed very poorly as we were on our way to dinner). This system may explain why there are so many divergent reviews. Our unit might have a very good owner, other units may have owners who don't take care of them. The owners may have to pay extra for maintenance; the unowned property could go unattended until booked... you get the idea. Housekeeping obviously does not communicate to management the problems that exist in a unit. We know this because when we handed our list of problems to the front desk, the manager said "thanks for telling us, because otherwise, how would we know?" Well, management SHOULD know. And unless they start talking to each other, it's obviously up to the guest to make sure they list EVERY LITTLE THING and report it to management so it can be addressed and you won't get charged. Despite the problems, overall, our stay was pleasant enough. I'm not sure I'd go back unless there were some changes, mostly in the staff communications and eliminating the sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: tjbaretta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once before but will not go back again. This past November we found a bug in our bed and put it in a bag and asked the front desk to change our bed linens. We did not know at the time that it was a bed bug. We came home and within 2 weeks I was bitten in nearly 20 places over several nights. I looked up bed bugs online and found the pictures to confirm that what we found at the hotel was indeed a bed bug. We had to throw away our box spring, mattress, carpet, etc. in our bedroom. I will be contacting the hotel to see if they will do anything about it....will update when I get a response.

Reviews.Title: “Coconut Malorie is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: suebee85
Reviews.Content: Coconut Malorie is a fantastic hotel. We booked 2 rooms for 2 nights on October 6th and 7th. Both rooms were very nice and very clean and fully operational. The employees were all friendly and helpful. The view of the bay is spectacular. Fagers Island is right next door and Seacrets just 10 short blocks away. We will definitely stay at Coconut Malorie again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Mold/Mildew Issue”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel20
Reviews.Content: Lobby is beautifully remodeled but the rooms are less than comfortable. When you first walk in the room you can smell the strong presence of mold/mildew. Then after closer examination you can see the mold/mildew on the ceiling coming from the air vent. It's so moist in the rooms that the carpet in the bedroom felt wet. My family woke up every morning with stuffy noses and a cough. This is a huge health hazard!

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean and False advertisement on internet”
Reviews.Author: SunAspen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I applied for two King size beds because we were taking our son and his friend. We arrived and went to the room and there was only one bed. We thought we were in a wrong room. We went to the courtesy desk to complain and were told the sofa bed is considered the other King size bed. We were stuck with the room, even though it was only one King Bed. after our long ride we were looking forward to the jet streams in the tub, ran the bath water, and nothing worked, the motor was humming and never did work. The freezer never did make ice for us and we were there for the weekend. The snack room was very poor, NO SNACKS, only one soda machine, nothing else, We went down to the Pool and Hot Tub, (Very Hot), We were told there is a bar set up at the Pool area, no one ever showed up to serve any type of beverage, Pictures show a different image than what the place really is. The rooms are not worth the money that is charged. older than pictures make it all out to be, NOT A HAPPY CUSTOMER FOR THE PRICE....Also, the elevators are very slow, they take for ever to get from floor to floor........................

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Coconut Malorie”
Reviews.Author: Mama2Boyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel/resort last year. The rooms were very nice and clean. The kitchenette and full size fridge came in handy when we didn't feel like going out for food. The pool was ok, could of been better. We would probably stay again if we could get the same rate. We just happened to belong to leisureplus. Their regular rate is just out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to go!!!”
Reviews.Author: kierysma
Reviews.Content: Well let me start off by saying how frightened I was to go to this hotel because I booked it and then read all the horrible reviews. However, once i arrived I felt so relieved. The front desk attendant was very pleasant and helpful. Yes, they do give you a sheet to sign that list the fines such as no smoking and don't take anything, of course. It's just like a two paragraph sheet, nothing major. No, there isn't a bellhop but there are luggage carts to facilitate taking your luggage to the room. The suite itself was absolutely lovely. There was a kitchenette, living room with big screen television, a lovely bathroom with vanity lights and a whirlpool tub. The balcony was small yet romantic to just stand out on and look ( past the swampy water) and out into the ocean. I guess it's according to where you stay whether or not it is loud but it was quite peaceful in our room, no disturbaces at all. No, there were no musty smells, the carpet was clean, and nothing was unsanitary. I really enjoyed my stay here and by reading other reviews, some people ar just very picky and sound like they need to stay at the Ritz and nothing less. I recommend this hotel to everyone and you will see why, TRUST ME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware... stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: USTraveller2007
Reviews.Content: I wish we had read the reviews before booking this place. We were passing through OC on a business trip, and reserved a room for one night online. The low price should have tipped us off... We felt like leaving as soon as we got there, but figured since it was only for one night it wouldn't matter.... in reality we should have slept in the car. Upon arrival, they require you sign a document with a whole list of 'rules' to be obeyed or there would be penalties to pay. We stay at a lot of hotels on business, and never have problems as we are model guests. We even put up with a lot and don't complain. But I was a bit suspicious nonetheless. And rightly so, as my credit card was charged over $500 extra after we left. Repeated calls back to the hotel went unanswered. They keep telling us the Manager is not there today. Messages on his/her answering service are not returned. We have yet to hear the explanation for the extra charges, even though we left the place in better shape than the way we got it. (btw, and we don't steal towels or anything else from hotels... that's lame and we don't want their stuff). We now sincerely beleive they routinely rip people off as often as they can. As for the condition of things, we must agree with the other negative comments about the hotel: The two elevators are verrrry slow and shaky. No bellhop service to take our luggage up. The hallways are hot and smelly. The carpets are old and stained, and the walls look like they haven't been painted in years. The room was dirty and musty smelling. Dirty carpets and floors (our feet turned black). Mold in the bathroom and stagnant water was in the tub. The bed was uncomfortable and worn out. The TV remote did not work, nor did the alarm clock. I asked for a wakeup call and never got it (checkout is at 10AM). The balcony is too small to sit on, overlooking a dirty swamp between the hotel and the nearby 'island'.
