Noise from the nightclub on that island goes on till about 3:00AM, with people yelling, screaming and carrying on. Taxis buzz in and out to shuttle crowds back and forth throughout the night. The view of the sunset was nice, but with all the noisy seagulls, birds and smelly swamp it was not worth it. The staff is nonresponsive and of no help. So if you still think this might be a nice place to stay, take your chances. When they bill you over $600 for a nights stay at this dump, don't say we didn't warn you. We will never be back and recommend that the place be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is...WOW!”
Reviews.Author: wainwrightwt
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I got an excellent price for staying at this hotel (about 50% off). Also, I stayed during the off season, so my experiences may be different then others. But, even baring that, the hotel was just great. The room had wonderful stone floors, and a nice old fashion type look and feel (I don't have the best vocabulary, so forgive me if I don't use appropriate terms). We had a great view (room 501 if you can get it), and the staff was pleasant. Everything was clean (unlike other reviews that I had read), and the only negative I can think of was that the small amount off carpet that was in the room, was a little old. I don't see how this hotel is only rated as a 2.5 star hotel. I would say it's a 3 or 3.5, but that's just my opinion. Anyway, if your looking for the best, this hotel is not it. But for averaging $120 a night, I think this is a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: zpxg
Reviews.Content: That resort was great. we were their for the weekend and we were pleasantly surprised. The beautiful view of the sunset and the fagers island was walking distance. We loved the room and we enjoyed the beautiful pool deck. we are going back thrie again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be decieving...”
Reviews.Author: HelenasMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Coconut Malorie. After searching for weeks we had finally booked this hotel despite the reviews on this website. Due to this being the height of the summer season, we had a difficult time finding a hotel that would meet our expectations and still be withing a reasonable price range. Plus, we were unable to have firm dates so many other places were booked (Hilton, Holiday Inn). Once again, we have found another overpriced OC hotel that is underwhelming. My husband and I brought our 18 month old and my mother along with us for the trip. We got the 2 room suite thinking either us or Mom could stay on the sofa bed. Upson arrival we were treated fine, but not offered any bell service to get our 2 luggage carts up to the room. After an evening on the boardwalk, we returned at 10 to find there was no bedding available for the sofa bed! WHAT A JOKE! The mattress was incredibly thin and we wern't offered a mattress pad. Repeated calls to the front desk went unanswered and my husband went down there to get some assistance. We were not given a blanket, but the offered a comforter to provide extra padding for the mattress! The sheets they gave us were king size to go onto a full size sofa bed! The bedroom was OK, but felt dated and dirty. The kitchen area and living room were nice and made a great place to hang out after the baby went to sleep. However, the door to the bedroom (where we put her pack and play) was similar to a shutter and sound and light passed right through. Fortunately, she was so sleepy it didnt matter. The bathroom was a pleasant surprise. The whirlpool was nice and there were always extra towels provided. We didn't appreciate the 10am phone call from housekeeping notifying us we were the last room left to clean (we found that very hard to believe). So, we were rushed from our room each day for housekeeping. The housekeepers were rude. Overall, the hotel has a LOT of potential, but it is obvious they are trying to make you feel that you are in a nicer place than you really are. The customer service is lacking and attention to detail is absent! I don't think we will be back. Next year we are thinking of going to the HIlton or Holiday Inn (but booking earlier) ....or we will skip OC all together and head down to VA beach for a cleaner, more affordable vacation. If you are not looking for elegance and just a family bare bones place this is fine....but don't expect to find what the photos lead you to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable, but okay”
Reviews.Author: mandalala
Reviews.Content: Smokers beware: you will have to sign a contract saying you will not smoke on the premises or be faced with a $500 fine. We booked on a hotels website, which did not put it so clearly, and were disappointed to learn we couldn't even do it on our balcony. Cons: the floor was dirty; the air conditioner kept resetting itself to 85 degrees, and was constantly blowing right on our heads (it's right by the couch and blows directly towards the head of the bed); the tv was to the left of the bed but to the right of the couch; checkout is at 10; AND, we got a call from "guest services" to see if we would like to purchase an interest in the resort (twice). However, I am very pleased to note the bathroom was huge, the kitchenette was convenient, and the sliding door plus screen were nice. There is only one vending machine, coke, but there is a 7-11 down the street. Also in walking distance of Fagers, which was nice. Seacrets is about 9 blocks down.

Reviews.Title: “Read me”
Reviews.Author: vacationdreamer11
Reviews.Content: The views were nice, but the hotel workers were no help to us. We tried asking them for ideas on whats fun and exciting... they were no help. The hotel condition was older. Not horrible, but not as nice as we had expected. It was really bad room service. We were with another couple and they never got fresh towels either. We always had to go to the front desk to ask for clean stuff...including toliet paper. We really liked the city, but If I could go back we would not stay at coconut malorie again. For the money, It was not worth it. Also, when we got there the iron, alarm clock and fan was missing. There was also a dirty wash cloth on the floor. Makes you wonder how good they cleaned huh? And last but now least, the heating and AC doesnt work. You have your own box, but the front desk controls it in the building.... Have fun and good luck

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John_Pupkin
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. That's wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This stay was horrible. At first I thought the hotel could have been cleaner, but we went ahead and stayed the weekend anyway. On saturday, when we woke up, something had ate through the bag of chips that were left on the counter-top. I was ready to leave, but my husband insisted on staying, since we were leaving the next morning anyway. As we were packing to leave on Sunday morning, mice were just running around the kitchen floor. I called for maintenence to come up and it took them 30 mins for them to get to my room. The guy next door heard me yelling and came over, only to tell me that they had mice running around their room as well. As I was down stairs making a complaint, another couple that was staying there said they had the same problem. I am having a very hard time getting in touch with the manager at the hotel for a refund. I advise anyone who plans to stay there....don't!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was great”
Reviews.Author: BullnRam1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website I told my husband I was a little leary about staying here. We arrived on Saturday and we were greeted by a friendly gentleman, who checked us in very quickly. The elevator was not "slow" and we didn't get "stuck" in it either. When we arrived at our room, we had ordered the romantic package so, we had champagne and roses in our room. I checked the bathroom and the sheets and they were clean.The room was very clean and was not "old" or "falling apart". I did a "test" and walked around in brand new white socks and I didn't get "black goo" on my socks. We had a wonderful time and our muffins that were delivered to us didn't have "ants" in them either. I would stay here again. I can see where some people could hear some noise from Fager's Island. I enjoyed my stay and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “What the Heck Happened Here?”
Reviews.Author: Dave at the Dog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a couple of years ago, and we couldn't have been more complimentary at that time. The location is great. The well-maintained rooms, with their tiled floors, tropical feel and Haitian art, were a couple of notches about the usual Ocean City fare. This was at that time what I considered to be the best hotel in town. Then we returned this past weekend. Gone are the tropically-cool walls of the lobby, replaced by a dark red bordello-inspired hue that has no place in a beach town. Gone (at least from my room) is the Haitian art. I actually don't remember seeing any art in the room. Gone is the good maintenance. There was no remote that actually worked the TV, for instance. The bathroom was showing signs of maintenance neglect. But the showstopper was the bed, which apparently contained a black hole in the middle. We would attempt to sleep on the edge, but would invariably end up falling in the center canyon at some point. Perhaps with the use of waist-ropes and grappling hooks, we could have stayed anchored to the edges. Couple the declining physical condition of the hotel with the fact that, despite that there were fewer than five guest's cars in the lot, we were given a room with a lame view, and you've got a less than desirable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the exterior, the Coconut Malorie looks very nice and luxurious. The lobby is also very nice. But as soon as you see the uninterested, gum chewing, annoyed looking front desk personnel with body piercings, the mood quickly changes. My husband and I were checking in for our one year anniversary. We dealt with the less than friendly front desk person and went up to our room. The elevator was old and needed a serious "face-lift". Our room was on the 5th floor and our room key was not working. My husband went back down to the front desk, they made us another key, which also did not work. We went up and down 4 times before the front desk person decided there must be a problem with our door and decided to call maintenance. Which took another 15 minutes just to find him. After thirty minutes of standing in the hallway, we finally got into our room. The room was pleasant looking at first, then we noticed that there was sand on the floors, dust on everything, wrinkled dingy yellowish bed sheets and dried food stuck all over the inside of the microwave. And the funny thing was, the housekeeper even left an envelope for a tip! I called the front desk to complain and the woman who identified herself as the manager on duty, said that there was nothing she could do until the morning when the general manager would be there. Well we were checking out in the morning so we were pretty much stuck with our dirty room. The next day I called the general manager to inform him of our complaints. He was very nice and promised to send us a certificate for two free nights at the hotel and also said he would "show us what true hospitality is". I was satisfied with that. I live less than 10 miles from the hotel and four weeks later I had still not received anything from the hotel. I then e-mailed him to inquire about our two free nights. He responded with one line saying "I'll send another one out to you." So that right there tells me that he completely forgot and had absolutely no intentions of going out of his way to make sure we had a better stay the second time. I have made reservations to use the two free nights for New Years, I will continue this review after that stay. Hopefully I'm wrong and they surprise me!

Reviews.Title: “Coconut Malorie Rocks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Ocean City several times a year for the past 40 years and stayed at too many places to even name. I have never experienced a hotel as great as the Coconut Malorie (and I've stayed at some of the most expensive.) When I walked into the lobby it took my breath away! Every staff member that I came into contact with was extremely polite and helpful. My housekeeping person was awesome. She didn't leave a spot of dust or sand anywhere in the suite, washed my dishes that I left in the sink, made little animal shapes from my washclothes --- too many things to list. I have never been satisfied with the cleanliness of my hotel until the Coconut Malorie. My son and his family and his in-laws each stayed at a different and more expensive hotels, but they were all saying they would stay at Coconut Malorie on their next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: editorinMD
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment. The CM could be a good hotel -- nice structure, lobby, etc. -- but the rooms and the staff bring it down. I've never stayed in hotel (or motel) where I was afraid to walk on the floor... until now. A little sand would have been understandable, but the floor seemed to be covered by some smelly mystery goo. It was foul. Like others have commented, I found that everything in the room was damaged, badly worn or in need of total replacement. If it hadn't been Sunfest weekend, I would have left for another hotel. I called the manager when I got home (he was "unavailable" both days we were there) and he refunded part of what we paid. By the sound of his voice, this is something he is very used to doing. I used to live in Ocean City and I know that there are a ton of hard-working people there who could clean this place up and turn it around. If I were CM management, I would clean house immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway at the Coconut Malorie was a bust”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't wait for our big weekend away to attend a Wedding at the Coconut Malorie. Within an hour after check in, we knew the hotel was bad news. The hallways leading to the room smelled like a musty old basement and the carpets were filthy, There was no air conditioning in the hallways..WHY? The elevators were like saunas. We arrived in our room, went to unpack and the bedroom was dark because they use low wattage bulbs and one light was out, making unpacking pretty tricky. Then I headed to the tub for a hot bath. The tub had sand it and the floor was gritty as well. When we pulled back the comforter on the bed, the sheets were really wrinkly. We were sure the sheets had not been changed so I started feeling around and sure enough there was sand on the sheets. We called to complain and they sent someone up to change the bedding. The carpet and tile in our main room were filthy and our feet turned black just walking around the suite. Then we had to call because our air conditioning was not working. We had to pack everything up and move to another room. Friends staying in an adjacent room appeared to have dirty sheets as well and asked to have their bedding changed. Their iron was broken, so they called for a replacement. The front desk said they'd be right up. The iron never showed up. We could see the hotel kitchen from our first room and it was nasty. Would not eat food from that hotel! We went to the pool after hearing they had a bar poolside and no one ever showed in 4 hours to actually work the bar/food area. An employee claimed that the hotel fired "her" that morning. The C malorie appeared to be extremely understaffed. Remember we had a wedding to attend? The CM told the groom to be the morning of the wedding that the oven and ice machine were broken! Wouldn't you think that the CM would bend over backwards to help the bride and groom to be, considering all the money they brought in from guests etc....No not the CM, instead that morning the GROOM went out making multiple trips to bring in 400lbs of ice so that it would be there for the reception. The Bride and Groom had to rent an oven...And here's the kicker..no working AC in the Hall...how nice was that for the newlyweds and their 100 guests? Shame on the Coconut Malorie for creating so much stress for the bride and groom. They should refund every expense to them as an apology! Find a better hotel if you want to get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “We Didn't Like It”
Reviews.Author: gordonr
Reviews.Content: We exchange a timeshare week. The week went from Aug 5th to Aug 12th. The check-in and check-ouut went fine. The lobby is very attractive. We were assigned to the 4th floor in a 1-bedroom unit. The living room, bath room, and bed room were lovely and comfortable. The kitchenette, for us, was a disaster. Here's why - We like to eat breakfast and a litght evening meal in the unit. Our big meal is at lunch. We are senior citizens, so night life is not a part of our what we do. OK! The problem rests with the mini-kitchen. There is no shelf space, so we had to put the coffee maker on one of the two stove burner units with a cutting board separating the two. At the same time there was no room for the toaster, so we plugged that into an outlet in the bathroom, and cooked our toast in there. We wanted to boil some eggs, but there was no sauce pan. The front desk sent one up. We also were short some glasses which the maid provided. The other main fault was that there is absolutely no place to store dry food - no closet space. Nice refrigerator, but no storage space - except in the bathroom under the sink unit. It really is a nice place, but for what is classed as a one-bedroom unit - the kitchen is completely inadequate for our taste and life style. - Maybe not yours. We also didn't like the idea of having to cross six lanes of traffic to get to the beach. BUT, the view from the room looking over the bay is magnificent. Will we go back there? No. If the kitchen isn't important to you, then you may like it. (They may even offer you an opportunity to buy into the place via a timeshare)

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: kopjon
Reviews.Content: Just checked out yesterday. DO NOT GO HERE. There are enough hotels that likely offer more for less Everything bad, from booking you to an occupied room to the worst attention to customer service and accomodations I've ever experienced I tried posting a review from their computers, but the only working one's connection was lost when I hit submit They need to shut this place down and pass some sort of noise ordinances to quiet Fagers Island. The music blares and the drunks shout well into the morning. Then, every morning at 6:30 sharp, the trash truck comes by to empty two large dumpsters filled with bottles Not one full night's sleep I will write a full review with pics asap

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1st impression was a good one, the loby was attractive and clean. Our room was was large and had a nice view of the bay. This unfortunately would be the last good impression. Although the kitchen and furnishings were kept relatively clean, the tile floor was filthy throughout. You could not walk far before you're feet turned black. When I nicely mentioned the problem to the front desk they were indifferent and annoyed. While we were out for the evening someone had made a feeble attempt to clean the floor and left us about 10 extra towels. Maybe they wanted us to make a carpet out of them. The bathroom was dirty and there was mold covering the grout around the jacuzzi (you would not get in this thing). The balcony is not big enough to fit a chair and is for standing only. The hallway smelled like fish and there are often bags of trash left in the hall for hrs. The stairways are disgusting and smell like landfills and they also double as smoking lounges. If you want to relax, this is not the place for you. The noise from Fager's goes late into the night (especially bad on weekends). Quite a few of the tenants were teens and a bit noisy. The overall grounds are kepy fairly nice. I have to believe that the only people who rave about this place must be owners.

Reviews.Title: “Very Shady!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Coconut Malorie is a decent place to say. However, I try to tell as many people as I come across not to stay there since my wife and I stayed there two summers ago. We had an ok time at Ocean City, Md and the resort definitely is beautiful. However, when we returned home and found that our credit card was billed an extra $200.00 by Coconut Malorie, we were a little shocked. I called the credit card company, and they told me to ask the resort. So after many phone calls not returned by management, being hung up, and disconnected (and this was all before my inquiry); I finally got through. I was told that I stole two bathrobes, which each cost $100. Now, I know none of you know me, but I did not steal any bathrobes. So if you want the biggest hassle of your life and someone accusing you of theft, go ahead and stay at Coconut Malorie. But hey, It does look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: clbalo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Coconut Malorie. We stayed there during the week of July 4th. From the room to the service received, everything was wonderful. Everything needed to cook a meal was included in the kitchenette. The bathroom is Huge! The view from the balcony was lovely. The noise that I expected from Fagers Island was barely noticeable (unless you kept the sliding door open). The decor of the room is very nice. The rooms look like they could be found in a tropical resort. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: galemelmer
Reviews.Content: well we just returned and will never go back ...for 109...they placed us first in a dirty room, the girl at the front desk was disheveled looking but the lobby looked new and inviting.we got to the room.which was ok.but not sparkling clean.the hotel is not well lit and kind of scary in some areas.for 10 dollars more we could have been ocean front at the holiday inn.the elevators are a disaster old scratched.and they started drilling in the room under us at 845 am !

HotelInfo.Name: Coconut Malorie
HotelInfo.Address: 200 59th Street on the Bay, Ocean City, MD 21842
